page.title: 19RELIGION
page.content: Serving the town and surrounding inhabitants of Maghull there are 7 churches, excluding those in the areas of Melling and Aintree. They all cater not only for worship but also as a centre for involvement of the parishioners in various societies and social functions. Our school, St. George's R.C., caters for members of the Polish community who first arrived during World War 2 and now have a mass said in Polish every Sunday in the school hall. The oldest church and the oldest building of any note is the chapel located in the grounds of St.Andrew's Parish Church and is believed to be 700 years old and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. An inscription relating to its insertion is to be found in Latin in one of the walls.
